article.headline: Fairleigh Dickinson 48, Cent. Connecticut St. 46
article.story: HACKENSACK, N.J. -- Kamil Svrdlik scored 14 of his 20 points in the second half, when Fairleigh Dickinson rallied from a 12-point halftime deficit to defeat Central Connecticut State 48-46 in a Northeast Conference game on Saturday. A layup by Svrdlik with 40 seconds to play gave the Knights (3-3, 2-0) a 46-45 lead, which they did not relinquish. Fairleigh Dickinson shot 60.9 percent (14 for 23) in the second half to 33.3 percent (8 for 24) for the Blue Devils (4-3, 1-1). Mike Scott scored six of his 14 points for the Knights during a 10-2 run in which they took a 40-39 lead with 6:23 remaining after trailing 37-30. After the Blue Devils regained a three-point lead, 45-42, with 3:25 left, a layup by Scott brought Fairleigh Dickinson within one at the 2:36 mark. Markeys Deans scored 11 points and Ken Horton and Robby Ptacek 10 each for Central Connecticut State.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
